Our police need all the resources available to them to keep themselves & our communities safe. That's why I'm proud to introduce the bipartisan POWER Act, which would provide state and local law enforcement with devices to better detect fentanyl. MORE: https://sen.gov/460J

Purdue Pharma bears significant responsibility for the opioid epidemic that claimed more than 47,000 lives in 2017. That’s why I’m asking Purdue to commit to not profiting from a new drug that could reverse opioid overdoses. MORE: https://sen.gov/74JV

#WV has more names on the Vietnam Wall per capita than any other state in the nation, and I am honored to sponsor a resolution that pays homage to the service of this generation of Veterans by designating March 29, 2019, as Vietnam Veterans Day. pic.twitter.com/9AoxQLkLW5

19% of WVians rely on SNAP, but proposed changes would take food assistance from those struggling to find stable employment while doing nothing to help them to become permanently employed. I'm urging @USDA Sec Sonny Perdue to withdraw the proposal. MORE: https://sen.gov/57X8

Bureaucrats in Washington should not be cutting vital health care access to Veterans in rural areas of #WV. That's why I introduced a bill to eliminate the commission that is tasked with finding facilities that should be consolidated or realigned. MORE: https://sen.gov/XVKV

While I appreciate the renewed conversation around #ClimateChange that the Green New Deal has sparked, I think we need to focus on real solutions that recognize the role fossil fuels will continue to play. That’s why I voted against the resolution. MORE: https://sen.gov/PKR4
Protecting West Virginians’ healthcare has always been my top priority and I will continue to fight for every West Virginian to have access to quality, affordable healthcare.
We have had two bipartisan healthcare fixes on Mitch McConnell’s desk that he refused to bring up to a vote because fixing the Affordable Care Act doesn’t benefit him politically.

.@TheJusticeDept’s refusal to defend millions of Americans & hundreds of thousands of WVians with pre-existing conditions is just plain wrong. Thousands of West Virginians who gained health insurance thru Medicaid expansion & the state health exchange could lose their insurance.

I strongly condemn @TheJusticeDept’s decision to argue against the constitutionality of the entire Affordable Care Act. This will put hundreds of thousands of West Virginians at risk of losing their health insurance. MORE: https://sen.gov/OJQ1

The City of Wheeling has shown that investments into our communities can be successful when paid with community involvement. Congratulations to Wheeling Heritage for winning the 2019 Great American Main Street Award! MORE: https://sen.gov/KMPQ

No one should be afraid of losing their job or housing b/c of their sexual orientation. I will continue working with the sponsors of the bill to build broad bipartisan support and find a viable path forward for these critical protections so that I can vote in support of this bill

I strongly support equality for all people and do not tolerate discrimination of any kind, but I am not convinced that the Equality Act as written provides sufficient guidance to the local officials who will be responsible for implementing it. MORE: https://sen.gov/JLXY

It is estimated that more than 20 Veterans die by suicide every day. Our Veterans deserve the very best access to mental health care, which is why I am honored to introduce this legislation that helps our bravest citizens. MORE: https://sen.gov/00X5

The budget proposal from @POTUS cuts Soc. Sec., Medicare & Medicaid, ends protections for people w/ pre-existing conditions, underfunds #WV economic development, & has years of trillion dollar deficits. This is not what the country needs or expects. MORE: https://sen.gov/57Z3

Let me be clear: I support total border security, which includes building a wall on our southern border. However, I believe that those funds, according to the Constitution, need to be appropriated through Congress, not through executive authority.

Regardless of who the President is, Congress has an obligation to defend the Constitution. That's why I oppose the President’s decision to unilaterally declare a national emergency & I'll vote for the emergency declaration resolution of disapproval. MORE: https://sen.gov/ZXJP

As West Virginians, we know that our hardworking and patriotic miners put their lives on the line every day. Gayle and I send our hearts out to Adam DeBoard’s family and loved ones, and we, like all West Virginians, will keep them in our prayers.

Today on #InternationalWomensDay - and every day - we celebrate and thank the women in our lives who are making our country and world a better place. We owe it to every American to stand up for women’s rights and bridge the #GenderEquality gap in our nation.
